xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.histograms

Class RankBasedHistogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.histograms.RankBasedHistogram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PointQuery

    public class RankBasedHistogram
extends Object
implements PointQuery
    This class provides an experimental histogram supporting point queries for categorical data over a nominal scale.

    Since this class is experimental, we apologize for problems with this class. We would please you to report bugs or problems to request@xxl-library.de!


    Also categorical data over a ordinal scale could be used by loosing the possibility of supporting range queries. Here should be mentioned that range query not means interval query. Interval queries are only supported on data belonging to an interval scale or higher or on data having a total ordering and a defined distance between two points. thus, to support range queries on categorical data a total ordering imposed by a comparator is needed.
    Categorical data only supports aggregations using the cumulative frequency distribution (cfd), so a cfd is needed for building histogram buckets. The buckets only support aggregations returning the average count (average frequency of cumulated data values) of each bucket.
    Different strategies to build up a histogram could be used. Each strategy must implement an inner interface RankBasedHistogram.ParitioningStrategy. The following strategies are provided:
    The maximum based strategy builds up a histogram with n buckets by sorting the cfd of the data by its rank (descending by frequency). Every data value of the n-1 most frequent data values will be assigned to a bucket by its own. The remaining data values will be pooled into the remaing bucket.
    The optimized maximum based strategy builds up a histogram with n buckets by sorting the cfd of the data by its rank (descending by frequency). Every data value of the n-1 most frequent data values will be assigned to a bucket by its own. But in contrast to the maximum based strategy data values with equal frequencies will be combined in one bucket. The remaining data values again will be pooled into the remaing bucket.
    The maximum differnces strategy builds up a histogram with n buckets by sorting the cfd of the data by its rank (descending by frequency). The buckets will be build up by dividing the data by the (n-1)-biggest differences between two successive objects according to their frequencies.

    One should remember that categorical data doesn't have a dimension nor a distance. If a domain D with categorical data is mapped to the natural numbers N this mapping function needs to be restricted to the image of f(D) in N and also needs to be bijective. Moreover, using a mapping function doesn't save memory to store a histogram because typically the mapping function is stored.
    This class is recommended for use only with categorical data over a nominal scale. Using non-categorical (numerical) data could lead to wrong estimations!
    See Also:
    AggregateGrouper, AggregateGrouper.CFDCursor, PointQuery, RangeQuery, WindowQuery
